page.title: 03Changes in Farming:Chatteris
page.content: Livestock farming has decreased. Farmers today tend to specialise so there are fewer mixed farms. Given such fertile soil and a low level of rainfall, most of the grassland has been ploughed up and used for crops. More{chemicals}are used to kill weeds and to control pests and diseases. The wheat crop, for example, is sprayed five times annually with a mixture of chemicals. Money paid on chemicals for one farm alone in 1985 amounted to{Â£64,000.}The use of chemicals has meant that better plant varieties can be developed and grown. More{machinery}is used on the farms now. In one instance the number of men has fallen from{30}to now only{6.}The work of men and horses has been taken over by machines such as combine harvesters, beet harvesters and tractors. Horses were used up to 1960.
